item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 12, 2025 at 2:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Just Fucking Use HTML (44 points | 32 comments)
2. University of Texas-Led Team Solves a Big Problem for Fusion Energy (52 points | 11 comments)
3. A community-led fork of Organic Maps (112 points | 62 comments)
4. Ruby 3.5 Feature: Namespace on read (10 points | discuss)
5. A crypto founder faked his death. We found him alive at his dad's house (100 points | 53 comments)

7. Paul McCartney, Elton John and other creatives demand AI comes clean on scraping (42 points | 34 comments)

11. Spark AI (YC W24) Is Hiring a Full Stack Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
12. The FTC puts off enforcing its 'click-to-cancel' rule (33 points | 4 comments)
13. US Copyright Office found AI companies breach copyright. Its boss was fired (190 points | 59 comments)
14. CrowdStrike CEO Cuts His Voting Power by 92% with Unexplained Gifts (55 points | 17 comments)

20. Making PyPI's test suite 81% faster – The Trail of Bits Blog (95 points | 24 comments)
21. Continuous glucose monitors reveal variable glucose responses to the same meals (11 points | 2 comments)
22. Show HN: CLI that spots fake GitHub stars, risky dependencies and licence traps (4 points | discuss)
23. Why Bell Labs Worked (264 points | 183 comments)
24. Car companies are in a billion-dollar software war (393 points | 677 comments)
25. Absolute Zero Reasoner (101 points | 20 comments)
26. The Academic Pipeline Stall: Why Industry Must Stand for Academia (134 points | 99 comments)
27. High-school shop students attract skilled-trades job offers (224 points | 370 comments)
28. Scraperr – A Self Hosted Webscraper (220 points | 73 comments)
29. Writing an LLM from scratch, part 13 – attention heads are dumb (311 points | 59 comments)
